70105212.synopsis: Clueless Dunder Mifflin manager Michael Scott welcomes a documentary crew to observe the office just as he learns that his branch could be downsized.
70105212.title: Pilot

70069628.synopsis: After receiving complaints about an employee's unsolicited repeat performance of a risqué comedy routine, Michael leads a diversity training session.
70069628.title: Diversity Day

70069629.synopsis: The company is cutting back on health care, which means switching to a plan with fewer benefits. Michael sends Dwight to tell the employees.
70069629.title: Health Care

70069630.synopsis: With rumors of downsizing floating around the office, a nervous Dwight approaches Jim about forming an alliance to protect their jobs.
70069630.title: The Alliance

70069631.synopsis: After planning a basketball game between the office and warehouse workers, Michael picks his "dream team" -- led by the company's sole black employee.
70069631.title: Basketball

70069632.synopsis: When an attractive woman shows up on the premises to sell handbags, Michael sees an opportunity for a red-hot office romance.
70069632.title: Hot Girl

70069633.synopsis: When corporate won't pay for the annual employee appreciation awards ceremony, Michael is forced to create a memorable evening on a shoestring budget.
70069633.title: The Dundies

70069634.synopsis: When HR announces a crackdown on sexual harassment, Michael is forced to curb his habit of forwarding inappropriate e-mails to his underlings.
70069634.title: Sexual Harassment

70069635.synopsis: With Michael and Dwight out of the office on a "work-related" condo search, Jim and Pam hold the first Dunder-Mifflin Olympic Games.
70069635.title: Office Olympics

70069636.synopsis: To pass the time during an unplanned fire drill, Jim organizes games of "Desert Island," "Would You Rather..." and "Who Would You Do?"
70069636.title: The Fire

70069637.synopsis: As he watches his employees prepare for the office's annual Halloween party, Michael agonizes over which of them he'll fire.
70069637.title: Halloween

70069638.synopsis: When Dwight, who holds a purple belt in karate, knocks out Michael during a playful scuffle, his humiliated boss invites everyone to a rematch.
70069638.title: The Fight

70069639.synopsis: Declaring Chili's "the new golf course," Michael convinces Jan that it's a great place to woo an important client.
70069639.title: The Client

70069640.synopsis: Instead of talking to his employees about their work, Michael uses their annual review time to gather feedback on his "relationship" with Jan.
70069640.title: Performance Review

70069641.synopsis: While monitoring his employees' e-mails, Michael stumbles upon an invitation to a barbecue at Jim's apartment that Michael was not invited to.
70069641.title: Email Surveillance

70069642.synopsis: Flush with cash from a recent bonus, Michael throws an office Christmas party. Jim begins planning the perfect Secret Santa gift for Pam.
70069642.title: Christmas Party

70069643.synopsis: The staff sets sail on a "booze cruise" that was chartered by Michael to boost office morale and kick-start a day of leadership training.
70069643.title: Booze Cruise

70069644.synopsis: In an unprecedented breakfast-in-bed accident, Michael burns his foot on a George Foreman Grill and demands that his staff caters to his every whim.
70069644.title: The Injury

70069645.synopsis: Frantic that a tactless Michael will reveal his secret crush on Pam, Jim tries desperately to bond with him over an uncomfortable lunch at Hooters.
70069645.title: The Secret

70069646.synopsis: A stench in Michael's office leads to a game of musical chairs, prompting Michael to take over Jim's cubicle and reminisce about his past.
70069646.title: The Carpet

70069647.synopsis: When Jan holds a "Women in the Workplace" seminar for the female employees, a jealous Michael retaliates by gathering the men for their own meeting.
70069647.title: Boys and Girls

70069648.synopsis: Michael and Jan head to New York City for a corporate meeting on Valentine's Day, prompting rumors that they're actually an item.
70069648.title: Valentine's Day

70069649.synopsis: After being named Salesman of the Year, Dwight must confront his fear of public speaking. Pam announces that she and Roy have set a wedding date.
70069649.title: Dwight's Speech

70069650.synopsis: "Take Your Daughter to Work Day" sets the stage for a series of classic Michael gaffes.
70069650.title: Take Your Daughter to Work Day

70069651.synopsis: Determined to enjoy his birthday despite everyone's anxiety over whether Kevin has skin cancer, Michael takes the entire crew to an ice-skating rink.
70069651.title: Michael's Birthday

70069652.synopsis: After finding a half-smoked joint, Dwight launches an investigation to find the culprit and earns the honorary title of official security supervisor.
70069652.title: Drug Testing

70069653.synopsis: When Michael takes over Toby's conflict-resolution duties, his approach of encouraging "cooperation through confrontation" may ruin office morale.
70069653.title: Conflict Resolution

70069654.synopsis: Michael finds himself trapped in an awkward love triangle when his boss, Jan, and his realtor, Carole, both accept his invitation to casino night.
70069654.title: Casino Night

70080624.synopsis: When Karen moves next door to Jim, the two have their first major argument. Michael lets a big secret slip while showing pictures of his Jamaica trip.
70080624.title: Back from Vacation

70080625.synopsis: Michael takes the staff for a day of fun at Lake Scranton, but the fun stops when he divides everyone into tribes and forces them to compete in challenges.
70080625.title: Beach Games

70080626.synopsis: Michael hires adult entertainers to spice up Phyllis' wedding shower. Meanwhile, Karen asks Pam whether she still has feelings for Jim.
70080626.title: Ben Franklin

70080627.synopsis: Michael makes a special Christmas greeting card for Carol. Meanwhile, Angela, Pam and Karen don't see eye to eye about the annual yuletide party.
70080627.title: A Benihana Christmas

70080628.synopsis: The mood in the office takes a depressing turn when Jan informs Michael that Dunder Mifflin's board plans to close the Scranton branch.
70080628.title: Branch Closing

70080629.synopsis: While Pam enters an art exhibition, Ryan brings Michael to his business class as a guest speaker. Back at the office, Dwight tries to capture a bat.
70080629.title: Business School

70080630.synopsis: During a party at the chief financial officer's home, Michael spills the beans about his relationship with Jan. And Pam gets assertive with Roy.
70080630.title: Cocktails

70080631.synopsis: At a convention, Michael and Dwight connect with Jim for a crazy party in their hotel room. Pam prepares for her first date since her breakup.
70080631.title: The Convention

70080632.synopsis: Michael suspects one of the new Stamford transfers is an ex-con. Andy turns to Jim for advice about how to win Pam over.
70080632.title: The Convict

70080633.synopsis: Jan arrives during Michael's "Movie Monday" and is mad that nobody is working. Dwight secretly meets with Jan about taking over Michael's job.
70080633.title: The Coup

70080634.synopsis: When Kelly invites the staff to attend a Hindu festival, Michael takes the opportunity to bring everyone closer and later makes a big announcement.
70080634.title: Diwali

70080635.synopsis: Jim tries to adjust to his promotion and life away from Pam. Back in Scranton, Michael teams with Dwight to identify the homosexuals in the office.
70080635.title: Gay Witch Hunt

70080636.synopsis: Michael looks for a way to properly honor his former mentor, while Jim's co-workers start to resent him when the boss gives him more responsibilities.
70080636.title: Grief Counseling

70080637.synopsis: Dwight gives Ryan a lesson in salesmanship and takes him to the family beet farm. Michael and Stanley eagerly anticipate their free yummy treats.
70080637.title: Initiation

70080638.synopsis: Karen and Jim interview for an opening at the corporate offices, though Michael thinks he has the job sewn up. Jan wants another chance with Michael.
70080638.title: The Job

70080639.synopsis: With Stamford's employees joining the Scranton team -- reuniting Pam and Jim -- Michael tries to impress everyone with a special welcome video.
70080639.title: The Merger

70080640.synopsis: An angry Roy storms into the office looking to hurt Jim, but an unexpected hero stops him. Darryl and Michael negotiate Darryl's pay raise.
70080640.title: The Negotiation

70080641.synopsis: Michael is honored when given the task of pushing Phyllis' dad down the aisle at her wedding. Dwight wants to ensure that no one crashes the ceremony.
70080641.title: Phyllis's Wedding

70080642.synopsis: Paper with an obscene watermark is inadvertently sent out, sending Michael into damage-control mode and forcing Angela to deal with angry callers.
70080642.title: Product Recall

70080643.synopsis: Andy maneuvers to be Michael's second in command and irritates everyone, especially Jim. The party-planning committee prepares for Oscar's return.
70080643.title: The Return

70080644.synopsis: During safety-training day, Michael is determined to show everyone that safety is no joke, and Dwight helps him prepare an over-the-top demonstration.
70080644.title: Safety Training

70080645.synopsis: Jim and Dwight are forced to team up when Michael sends the staff out on sales calls. Later, Michael chooses Andy as his partner.
70080645.title: Traveling Salesmen

70080646.synopsis: When Phyllis gets flashed, Michael organizes a special outing for the ladies to boost their morale as Andy and Dwight try to track down the culprit.
70080646.title: Women's Appreciation

70108687.synopsis: A freak accident spurs Michael to organize an employee charity run. Jim and Pam go public with their love. Dwight destroys Angela's personal property.
70108687.title: Fun Run

70108688.synopsis: Newly promoted Ryan returns to the Scranton branch and receives a cold reception to his announcement of the company's new Web site.
70108688.title: Dunder Mifflin Infinity

70108689.synopsis: Dwight tries to beat the company's new website in one-day sales. Michael retaliates when he isn't invited to the site launch party in New York.
70108689.title: Launch Party

70108690.synopsis: Jan's excessive spending causes major money problems for Michael. Jim and Pam spend an unforgettable night on Dwight's farm.
70108690.title: Money

70108691.synopsis: Michael writes, produces and directs a commercial promoting the Scranton branch. Brokenhearted Dwight learns an intriguing secret about Angela.
70108691.title: Local Ad

70108692.synopsis: Furious when Karen offers Stanley a position at her office branch in Utica, Michael tricks Jim into joining him and Dwight in a prank against her.
70108692.title: Branch Wars

70108693.synopsis: When Michael is excluded from an executive retreat in the woods, he treats himself to a lone "Survivor Man" style campout.
70108693.title: Survivor Man

70108694.synopsis: Jan tries to manipulate Michael in a bogus lawsuit against Dunder Mifflin. Pam is incensed when Kelly gloats over an incident between Jim and Darryl.
70108694.title: The Deposition

70108695.synopsis: The employees witness Michael's dysfunctional relationship with Jan at a dinner party, and Dwight tries to make Angela jealous with an unusual date.
70108695.title: Dinner Party

70108696.synopsis: Dunder Mifflin loses two assigned parking spaces, and Michael's infatuation with a catalog model makes him reconsider his relationship with Jan.
70108696.title: The Chair Model

70108697.synopsis: Michael and Dwight go clubbing with Ryan. Back at the office, Jim's plan to save the staff from a Saturday at the office backfires.
70108697.title: Night Out

70108698.synopsis: Stanley disrespects Michael in front of the other employees, and a used-car purchase between Dwight and Andy creates a major rift.
70108698.title: Did I Stutter

70108699.synopsis: Michael, Pam, Oscar and Darryl attend a job fair at Pam's alma mater. Across town, Jim attempts his first "hard sell" over a round of golf.
70108699.title: Job Fair

70108700.synopsis: On Toby's last day at the company, Michael falls in love with his replacement. Jim's elaborate plans for his proposal to Pam are derailed.
70108700.title: Goodbye, Toby

70126223.synopsis: A company weight loss initiative has everyone obsessed with their diet. Michael pursues a friendship with his new HR rep and Jim pops the question.
70126223.title: Weight Loss: Part 1

70126224.synopsis: Holly's business ethics seminar gets out of control when Michael lets everyone speak freely about their unethical behavior at work.
70126224.title: Business Ethics

70126225.synopsis: Michael prepares for Jan's baby by having Dwight go over various birthing scenarios, and tells Holly he'll pretend to dislike her for Jan's benefit.
70126225.title: Baby Shower

70126226.synopsis: Michael and Holly get an early start on their date night. When the office is robbed, Michael holds an auction to raise money for items lost.
70126226.title: Crime Aid

70126227.synopsis: Pam is the only one wearing a costume on Halloween. Holly and Michael take the long trip to Nashua after they get some shocking news from corporate.
70126227.title: Employee Transfer

70126228.synopsis: Dwight and Jim are shocked by the results of the annual customer survey report. Pam and Jim spend every minute together via Bluetooth.
70126228.title: Customer Survey

70126229.synopsis: Michael is ecstatic when he's sent on a business trip. Andy and Oscar become unlikely friends when Michael decides to bring them along.
70126229.title: Business Trip

70126230.synopsis: Someone makes a huge mess in the microwave and will not clean it up. Michael realizes that changes in his staff have occurred without his knowing.
70126230.title: Frame Toby

70126231.synopsis: Michael learns that the office must spend a $4300 surplus or lose it, and chaos breaks out as everyone fights to get what they want.
70126231.title: The Surplus

70126232.synopsis: Phyllis's party goes up in flames when Meredith's hair catches on fire, and Dwight corners the market on the hottest toy of the Christmas season.
70126232.title: Moroccan Christmas

70126233.synopsis: Andy still doesn't know about Angela's affair with Dwight. When Michael spills the beans, Dwight and Andy take matters into their own hands.
70126233.title: The Duel

70126234.synopsis: Michael and Dwight go undercover to spy on a rival paper company. Meanwhile, the rest of the office debates a burning question: Is Hilary Swank hot?
70126234.title: Prince Family Paper

70126235.synopsis: Dwight's fire drill causes Stanley to collapse from a heart attack. Afterward, Dwight must try to make amends to the stressed-out office.
70126235.title: Stress Relief: Part 1

70126236.synopsis: Michael visits other branches to explain Scranton's relative success. Dwight and Jim, heading the party-planning committee, forget a birthday.
70126236.title: Lecture Circuit: Part 1

70126237.synopsis: Michael and Pam continue their tour of the branches. Dwight and Jim struggle with their party-planning duties. Angela's new cat causes a stir.
70126237.title: Lecture Circuit: Part 2

70126238.synopsis: On Valentine's Day, Michael meets a mysterious woman, Dwight and Kevin find single women, and Jim and Pam are banished for public affection.
70126238.title: Blood Drive

70126239.synopsis: Michael causes a huge problem when he comes up with the idea to put "golden tickets" into packages of paper for clients to redeem for discounts.
70126239.title: Golden Ticket

70126240.synopsis: Michael has big plans for his 15th anniversary party, but the company's new, no-nonsense vice president has some ideas of his own.
70126240.title: New Boss

70126241.synopsis: Michael's relationship with the new vice president becomes increasingly tense, Pam battles a new copier and Kelly develops a crush.
70126241.title: Two Weeks

70126242.synopsis: After making a bad impression on his new boss, Jim runs into him during a parking lot soccer game. Meanwhile, Michael is afraid to leave his house.
70126242.title: Dream Team

70126243.synopsis: Dwight and Andy plan a hunting trip. Asked for a "rundown," Jim spends his day figuring out what that is. Michael hosts a Paper & Pancakes lunch.
70126243.title: Michael Scott Paper Company

70126244.synopsis: Dwight's loyalty to Michael is tested when he finds a new hero in Charles. Meanwhile, Andy tries to provide for all of Jim's emotional needs.
70126244.title: Heavy Competition

70126245.synopsis: Michael's new company struggles to make early-morning deliveries, while the office tries to get their expense reports in on time.
70126245.title: Broke

70126246.synopsis: Michael mediates a dispute within his new sales team. Meanwhile, trouble brews among several employees over the term "Casual Fridays."
70126246.title: Casual Friday

70126247.synopsis: Michael gets into the café/disco scene. Meanwhile, Pam and Jim decide to take a secret trip.
70126247.title: Cafe Disco

70126248.synopsis: Michael and Holly are reunited at the annual company picnic, where the office also competes in the picnic's volleyball tournament.
70126248.title: Company Picnic

70126249.synopsis: When Michael learns that his frazzled employees consider him their number one stressor at work, he insists on a no-holds-barred roast of himself.
70126249.title: Stress Relief: Part 2

70126250.synopsis: The office continues its efforts to win the Dunder Mifflin weight loss initiative. Meanwhile, Jim misses Pam, who's attending art school in New York.
70126250.title: Weight Loss: Part 2

70151933.synopsis: Michael feels left out as the rest of the office gossips about the summer interns. Meanwhile, Andy struggles with heterosexuality.
70151933.title: Gossip

70151934.synopsis: A request by Jim leaves Michael feeling insecure and defensive. Meanwhile, Pam deals with the guest list for the wedding.
70151934.title: The Meeting

70151935.synopsis: David Wallace breaks the bad news that not everyone will get a raise this year, and Dwight reaches his breaking point with Jim.
70151935.title: The Promotion

70151936.synopsis: In part 1 of a 2-part episode, the office travels to Niagara Falls to celebrate Jim and Pam's wedding under orders not to mention Pam's pregnancy.
70151936.title: Niagara: Part 1

70151937.synopsis: In part 2 of a 2-part episode, Michael, Dwight and Andy all want to hook up with guests at Jim and Pam's wedding, and Michael and Dwight meet twins.
70151937.title: Niagara: Part 2

70151938.synopsis: Michael meets with an insurance salesman in the office, but Dwight and Andy think he's part of the mafia. Erin accidentally ruins Pam's painting.
70151938.title: Mafia

70151939.synopsis: Michael shocks Jim and Pam when he reveals the identity of the new woman he's been dating. Dwight apologizes to Jim with a strange peace offering.
70151939.title: The Lover

70151940.synopsis: Michael gets teased by everyone at the office after he he takes an embarrassing fall at a meeting. Pam and Andy go on a sales call together.
70151940.title: Koi Pond

70151941.synopsis: Jim and Pam have no choice but to go out with Michael and Helene. Strangely, Dwight is doing nice things for everyone in the office.
70151941.title: Double Date

70151942.synopsis: Michael forces the office into a day of strange diversions, upsetting Jim and leading others to wonder if Michael has gone insane.
70151942.title: Murder

70151943.synopsis: Michael gets excited when he's invited by David Wallace to be honored onstage at the Dunder Mifflin shareholder meeting in New York.
70151943.title: Shareholder Meeting

70151944.synopsis: Michael can't keep a promise he made to a group of kids 10 years ago. Meanwhile, Jim starts an Employee of the Month program to improve morale.
70151944.title: Scott's Tots

70151945.synopsis: Michael is outraged when Jim allows Phyllis to be Santa at the office Christmas party. Jim and Dwight try to get everyone into the holiday spirit.
70151945.title: Secret Santa

70151946.synopsis: When a potential buyer visits, Michael, Dwight, Andy and Pam pull out all the stops in hopes of impressing him with their high-profile contacts.
70151946.title: The Banker

70151947.synopsis: Michael struggles to accept Sabre's new policies; Pam and Jim interview with a prestigious daycare; Andy and Erin work on a welcome song for Sabre.
70151947.title: Sabre

70151948.synopsis: The office loves Sabre CEO Jo Bennett, until she says that there can't be two branch managers and that either Michael or Jim must go back to sales.
70151948.title: Manager and the Salesman

70151949.synopsis: Pam's contractions begin, and the rest of the office tries to distract her from the pain with food and entertainment.
70151949.title: Delivery: Part 1

70151950.synopsis: Everybody plays the waiting game as Pam prepares to give birth. Dwight decides to fix the cabinets in Pam and Jim's kitchen.
70151950.title: Delivery: Part 2

70151951.synopsis: Michael mistakenly believes that he impressed Jo; Dwight disrupts Jim's first day back from paternity leave; Andy and Erin have an unusual first date.
70151951.title: St. Patrick's Day

70151952.synopsis: When the sales staff lets Sabre's new "sales is king" policy get to their heads, Michael hides their new, prized leads.
70151952.title: New Leads

70151953.synopsis: Michael gets kicked out of the bar when he tries to impress a friend of Jim and Pam's. Andy and Erin try to keep their relationships under wraps.
70151953.title: Happy Hour

70151954.synopsis: Andy pulls out all the stops for Erin on Secretary's Day, but when Michael takes her to lunch, he lets slip about Andy's relationship with Angela.
70151954.title: Secretary's Day

70151955.synopsis: Pam and Jim work on their first sales pitch to a local restaurant, while Dwight encourages Kelly to try out for the minority training program.
70151955.title: Body Language

70151956.synopsis: Michael has Dwight investigate when he suspects Donna is cheating. Meanwhile, Andy is frustrated when no one takes his customer's complaint seriously.
70151956.title: The Cover-Up

70151957.synopsis: Michael is oddly upbeat after hearing bad news about Donna; new parents Pam and Jim can't stay awake; Dwight won't honor his contract with Angela.
70151957.title: The Chump

70151958.synopsis: When the press reports that Sabre's printers catch on fire, Jo hunts for the whistleblower. Everyone suspects Andy, who denies leaking the story.
70151958.title: Whistleblower

70189006.synopsis: Michael refuses to fire the office assistant, and Andy plays it cool after Erin shows interest in another man. Meanwhile, Pam plays an office prank.
70189006.title: Nepotism

70189007.synopsis: Michael goes to Toby for counseling, and Dwight vows revenge after a shop owner snubs him. Meanwhile, Pam conspires to change her job title.
70189007.title: Counseling

70189008.synopsis: Andy invites the entire office to his community theater production of "Sweeney Todd," while Jim and Pam struggle with their incompetent babysitter.
70189008.title: Andy's Play

70189009.synopsis: Michael, believing he has herpes, contacts all his ex-girlfriends. Andy tries to play on Erin's compassionate side by holding a sex education meeting.
70189009.title: Sex Ed

70189010.synopsis: When a competing sales associate steals a Dunder Mifflin client, Michael, Jim and Dwight set up a sting to find out his secrets. Andy starts a band.
70189010.title: The Sting

70189011.synopsis: When Darryl takes an idea to corporate over his head, Michael freaks out. Everyone gets competitive as the Halloween costume contest gets underway.
70189011.title: Costume Contest

70189012.synopsis: Michael invites the entire office to celebrate the christening of Pam and Jim's baby, Cece.
70189012.title: Christening

70189013.synopsis: Erin and Gabe invite the office over for a "Glee" viewing party. Michael deals poorly with people calling Gabe his boss. Andy grows jealous of Gabe.
70189013.title: Viewing Party

70189014.synopsis: More than money is at stake as Michael helps charm people into investing in Ryan's start-up. Dwight creates a hay festival in the parking lot.
70189014.title: WUPHF.com

70189015.synopsis: After reading about China growing as a global power, Michael decides China must be stopped before it takes over the United States.
70189015.title: China

70189016.synopsis: Toby has to take a leave of absence and corporate sends Holly Flax to cover for him. Michael forces Pam to throw a second Christmas party.
70189016.title: Classy Christmas: Part 1

70189017.synopsis: Michael wants to throw a second Christmas party to celebrate Holly's returns to Scranton. Jim regrets agreeing to a snowball fight with Dwight.
70189017.title: Classy Christmas: Part 2

70189018.synopsis: Michael prepares himself for the good or bad news about Holly and her boyfriend. Pam puts up a board for everyone to post New Year's resolutions.
70189018.title: Ultimatum

70189019.synopsis: Dealing with low sales, Andy holds a business seminar with the help of some special guests. Michael and Holly turn the event into an improv challenge.
70189019.title: The Seminar

70189020.synopsis: When Jim gets an emergency call from Helene, he leaves Michael in the bathroom of a gas station. Holly, Erin and Dwight set out to find Michael.
70189020.title: The Search

70189021.synopsis: It's Valentine's Day, and Michael and Holly's displays of affection are making everyone uncomfortable. A champagne lunch causes complications.
70189021.title: PDA

70189022.synopsis: After 11 years in the making, Michael is finally ready to present his movie, "Threat Level Midnight," to his co-workers and love interest, Holly.
70189022.title: Threat Level Midnight

70189023.synopsis: After many years and motel rooms, traveling salesman (and Michael's best friend) Todd is ready to leave the road and take a desk job in the office.
70189023.title: Todd Packer

70189024.synopsis: The warehouse and office staff hold a garage sale; Michael seeks his coworkers' advice on an important decision.
70189024.title: Garage Sale

70189025.synopsis: Everyone hopes to make a good first impression on the new manager: Andy finds himself typecast, while Jim and Pam worry they've come on too strong.
70189025.title: Training Day

70189026.synopsis: Michael trains Deangeleo to take over the job of hosting the Dundie Awards. Erin struggles with her dislike of her boyfriend, Gabe.
70189026.title: Michael's Last Dundies

70189027.synopsis: Michael, about to leave for Colorado, says his goodbyes to each co-worker. Deangelo and Andy scramble to keep Michael's biggest clients.
70189027.title: Goodbye, Michael

70189028.synopsis: Deangelo's true management style is finally revealed.
70189028.title: The Inner Circle

70189029.synopsis: Dwight takes over as acting manager and applies Draconian tactics to the office. Meanwhile, Gabe tries to win Erin back.
70189029.title: Dwight K. Schrute, (Acting) Manager

70189030.synopsis: Jim heads a search committee that interviews the managerial candidates, including Andy and Darryl. Dwight tries to get back in the race.
70189030.title: Search Committee: Part 1

70189031.synopsis: Jim heads a search committee that interviews the managerial candidates, including Andy and Darryl. Dwight tries to get back in the race.
70189031.title: Search Committee: Part 2

70210965.synopsis: The staff is hit with a double whammy as Scranton gets a new regional manager and Robert California takes the helm of Dunder Mifflin Sabre as CEO.
70210965.title: The List

70210966.synopsis: Robert California wants to double sales growth, and Andy responds with an unusual incentive plan to motivate the team.
70210966.title: The Incentive

70210967.synopsis: When the warehouse crew quits after winning the lotto, the team pitches in to keep Dunder Mifflin humming.
70210967.title: Lotto

70210968.synopsis: Trying to gain some respect from his family and new boss, Andy throws a garden party at Schrute Farms.
70210968.title: Garden Party

70210969.synopsis: Erin struggles to pull off the ultimate Halloween party, juggling the expectations of Robert California, Andy and the staff.
70210969.title: Spooked

70210970.synopsis: Challenged to improve productivity, Dwight develops an accountability booster program that threatens to get the entire office fired.
70210970.title: Doomsday

70210971.synopsis: Pam's convinced her temp replacement is the apple of Jim's eye; Robert California has a musical proposition for Andy, Darryl and Kevin.
70210971.title: Pam's Replacement

70210972.synopsis: Andy tries to fire up the team with a trip to Gettysburg; Robert California challenges the team to think way outside the box.
70210972.title: Gettysburg

70210973.synopsis: Andy's in a tough spot when Robert California sends him mixed messages about hiring his wife.
70210973.title: Mrs. California

70210974.synopsis: Andy wants to make everyone's Christmas wishes come true -- no matter how distraught they are.
70210974.title: Christmas Wishes

70210975.synopsis: Pressed to boost the bottom line, Andy finds a novel way to improve sales, while Dwight explores corporate opportunities outside Scranton.
70210975.title: Trivia

70210976.synopsis: Robert invites the staff to his house for one last party before the home goes up for sale.
70210976.title: Pool Party

70210977.synopsis: Jim comes under fire when the office realizes he skipped work by faking jury duty to spend time with Pam and the new baby.
70210977.title: Jury Duty

70210978.synopsis: Dwight is recruited to lead a team headed to Florida to create a chain of Sabre retail stores.
70210978.title: Special Project

70210979.synopsis: To get noticed by Corporate, Dwight takes his team to Tallahassee to conceive a new chain of Sabre retail stores.
70210979.title: Tallahassee

70210980.synopsis: Nellie pits Packer against Dwight for the VP job, Jim fends off an amorous intruder, and Andy works the Scranton team overtime.
70210980.title: After Hours

70210981.synopsis: Dwight plans an impressive presentation for the Sabre store, and Andy suffers an embarrassing injury.
70210981.title: Test the Store

70210982.synopsis: Robert hates Nellie's business plan, and Jim tries to save Dwight from being fired. Meanwhile, Andy learns that Erin isn't returning to Scranton.
70210982.title: Last Day in Florida

70210983.synopsis: As Andy heads south to Florida to sweep Erin off her feet, Nellie makes herself at home in his office in Scranton.
70210983.title: Get the Girl

70210984.synopsis: As Erin and Andy plot how he should break up with Jessica, Robert California orders the office to throw a welcome party for Nellie.
70210984.title: Welcome Party

70210985.synopsis: Andy's job -- and manhood -- are called into question as he returns with Erin to Scranton.
70210985.title: Angry Andy

70210986.synopsis: Unemployed Andy crashes a fundraiser for the Senator -- and ends up the unlikely owner of a dozen disabled dogs.
70210986.title: Fundraiser

70210987.synopsis: A drunken Robert California closes a branch, igniting a sales war.
70210987.title: Turf War

70210988.synopsis: Dwight raises suspicions by offering free portraits; Andy returns with some self-satisfying news.
70210988.title: Free Family Portrait Studio

70286845.synopsis: Jim and Dwight are thrown off by the arrival of two young employees that the others dub "the new Jim" and "Dwight Jr." Andy returns from training.
70286845.title: New Guys

70286846.synopsis: Pam and Jim go to Roy's wedding, where his toast takes everyone by surprise -- causing Pam and Jim to examine their own relationship.
70286846.title: Roy's Wedding

70286847.synopsis: Andy learns he is related to Michelle Obama, causing a stir around the office. Jim's elaborate trick has Dwight thinking Jim is an Asian man.
70286847.title: Andy's Ancestry

70286848.synopsis: After Jim convinces Dwight that the building is unsafe, Dwight rents a bus and sets up the office inside -- and eventually they hit the road.
70286848.title: Work Bus

70286849.synopsis: It's Halloween in the office, and Andy invites his college a cappella group to perform, which leads to a confrontation with his frenemy Broccoli Rob.
70286849.title: Here Comes Treble

70286850.synopsis: Andy must man up when his dad blows all of the family's money. When Dwight is interviewed on local radio, Jim tortures him with bizarre call-ins.
70286850.title: The Boat

70286851.synopsis: To help Dwight overcome his greatest professional handicap -- selling to women -- Pam and the ladies teach him how to interact with female clients.
70286851.title: The Whale

70286852.synopsis: Angela discovers her husband's affair and goes to Dwight for help. Jim needs a favor from Stanley and Phyllis, who milk it for all it's worth.
70286852.title: The Target

70286853.synopsis: When the party planning committee drops the ball on the Christmas party, Dwight gets everyone to celebrate a traditional Schrute German Christmas.
70286853.title: Dwight Christmas

70286854.synopsis: Pam accidentally brings lice into the office and lets Meredith take the fall. Meanwhile, Jim woos a potential business associate in Philadelphia.
70286854.title: Lice

70286855.synopsis: Dwight and Clark pose as father and son to make a sale. Meanwhile, Darryl interviews at Jim's company and Pam comes for a surprise visit.
70286855.title: Suit Warehouse

70286856.synopsis: Dwight tries to prevent Darryl's move to Athlead. Jim is forced to miss Cece's first recital when a big investor exits his new company.
70286856.title: Customer Loyalty

70286857.synopsis: David Wallace tasks Dwight with finding a new part-time salesman to fill in for Jim. Dwight assembles a super-team of his cronies, starting with Mose.
70286857.title: Junior Salesman

70286858.synopsis: When Pam's warehouse mural is defaced, Dwight and Nellie spring to action. Darryl has difficulty dealing with Jim's habits in their shared apartment.
70286858.title: Vandalism

70286859.synopsis: The office pairs off into pretend couples to take advantage of a Valentine's Day discount at the mall. Erin assures Pete she will break up with Andy.
70286859.title: Couple's Discount

70286860.synopsis: Pam interviews for a job in Philadelphia with a manager who gives her deja-vu. Dwight brings Angela on a mission to clean his elderly Aunt Shirley.
70286860.title: Moving On

70286861.synopsis: Dwight travels home for a customary Schrute funeral. He and his siblings receive a surprise inheritance that's not entirely welcome.
70286861.title: The Farm

70286862.synopsis: Everyone is excited when promos start running on TV for the documentary. Dwight makes Angela jealous when he starts dating a Brussels sprout farmer.
70286862.title: Promos

70286863.synopsis: "Stairmaggedon" strikes when the elevator goes out and everyone is forced to take the stairs. Dwight forces Stanley to do an important sales call.
70286863.title: Stairmageddon

70286864.synopsis: Dwight and Angela compete in an office-wide paper airplane contest. A local talent agent helps Andy with his first acting role in an industrial film.
70286864.title: Paper Airplane

70286865.synopsis: Andy tries to work up the nerve to quit his job and pursue his dreams of stardom. Dwight finally receives his karate black belt from his new sensei.
70286865.title: Livin' the Dream

70286866.synopsis: While the office readies for the documentary premiere, Jim holds tryouts to hire an assistant to the assistant to the regional manager.
70286866.title: A.A.R.M

70286867.synopsis: In the series finale, months after the airing of the documentary, the workers of Dunder Mifflin, past and present, gather for a wedding.
70286867.title: Finale
